title: Add a CC field for additional email recipients during expense report submission in New Expensify.

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** v9.3.11-12
**Reproducible in staging?:** Y
**Reproducible in production?:** Y
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @PedroEspinoza1999 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1769724682928639?thread_ts=1765823786.073499&cid=C049HHMV9SM)

## Action Performed:

1. User creates or opens an expense report in New Expensify
2. User reviews the expenses and proceeds to submit the report
3. User looks for an option to CC additional email addresses for visibility
4. No CC field or option is available during the submission flow

## Expected Result:
Users should be able to add one or more email addresses in a CC field when submitting an expense report so additional stakeholders can receive a notification or copy of the submission.
## Actual Result:
There is no option to CC other recipients during the report submission process. While users can tag other admins within the report, this does not generate an email notification. Additionally, users are unable to directly send a PDF copy of the report within the platform to external recipients who do not have Expensify access—something the CC feature in Expensify Classic supports.
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

title: [$250] Change button color for one-button modals to grey

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
This issue is to change the button color when there is a single button modal popup. Currently the button is green, which indicates success, but this is not always the case. Sometimes this modal pops up when something fails, and having a green button makes it seem like the action was successful. For example, when a customer exports reports to QBO and the export fails, the popup banner that says the export fails is colored green. Customers say this is confusing, as when the export is successful, the banner is also green. **New button idea:** [Related slack thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1769021541380959)

title: [$125] Reports page filter inconsistencies and clean-up

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
We're not currently alphabetizing the options in the `Feed` filter. We're also not adding a search/filter input when were are more than 12 options. We're also inconsistently labeling the search input depending on the filter. Let's address all of these inconsistencies in this issue. All in all, we need to: - **Alphabetize** the options in the `Feed` filter - **Show a search input anytime there are 12 or more options**. This should be the case for these filters: - `From`, `Group currency`, `To`, `Workspace`, `Card`, `Category`, `Currency`, `Purchase currency`, `Report fields`, `Tag`, `Tax rate` (and `In` for chats/tasks and `Assignee` for tasks) - **When the search input is shown, consistently use the `Search` label**. Right now it's sometimes "Search for someone" then sometimes "Name, email, or phone number" then sometimes "Group currency" or similar.

**Device used:** Xiaomi Redmi Note 10S - Android 13
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/home
2. Open a paid expense
3. Tap header
4. In details page, select from "link " and tap on it
5. Note in expense preview page , drag handler is shown
6. Open the expense
7. Note drag handler is still displayed

## Expected Result:
Drag handler must not be shown in preview and expense details page.

## Actual Result:
Drag handler is shown in preview and expense details page.

Unknown

labels.name: External

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.11-1
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176932/test-cases/41237694
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** gatantm+6125@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Google Pixel 9 Pro, Android 16, iPhone 12 mini, iOS 16.7, iPhone 17 Pro Max, iOS 26.2
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
1. Launch expensify
2. Tap on FAB and select Create expense
3. Tap on Scan and select the multiple expenses icon
4. Tap the shutter to take a photo
5. Enable the flash
6. Tap the shutter again and while the photo is taken tap the next icon on bottom right (so tap the shutter and immediately the next button)

## Expected Result:
There's no error message. Ideally the app waits for the photo to be taken until going to the next step (similarly to the first photo or the single expense flow)

## Actual Result:
There's a Camera error and the photo is not added. Without flash the same flow works and the photo is taken and added as new expense

## Workaround:
Unknown

- [x] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome

labels.name: AITriage
labels.description: Melvin Triage of an issue

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.11-1
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176691/test-cases/41236744
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+012926dr03@applause.expensifail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** MacOS 26.2 / Chrome, Safari
**App Component:** Workspace Settings

## Action Performed:
1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Login with new Expensifail account
3. Create new workspace
4. Go to Workspace Settings > Workflows > Payments > Add bank account
5. Select "Log into your bank"
6. Select bank (Regions bank) and follow the flow until the first personal info page > First and Last name
7. Go Offline by 1) turning Wi-Fi off or 2) using the troubleshoot panel (cmd+D).
8. Follow the BA connection flow while offline until all personal info has been entered
9. Refresh browser page
10. Go Online

## Expected Result:
Verify that after refreshing the app the "Personal Information" step is filled out with the information that was added on the offline steps

## Actual Result:
1. If user turns wi-fi off to go offline > All Personal information entered offline is not saved.
2. If user uses troubleshoot panel (cmd+D) to go offline > Upon returning online user will see an endless spinner and “Not here…” page in the background

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome

**Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome
**App Component:** Workspace Settings

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
- Workspace is set up with Expensify card feature.

1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to workspace settings > Expensify Card.
3. Click Issue card.
4. On cardholder step, enter a phone number (60128323983), select the phone number and click Invite.
5. Complete the rest of the steps and reach confirm page.
6. On confirm page, click Issue card.
7. Enter magic code.

## Expected Result:
The card will be assigned successfully.

## Actual Result:
Error "Oops... something went wrong and your request could not be completed. Please try again later." shows up when assigning Expensify card to phone number user invited during issue card flow.

## Workaround:
Unknown

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.11-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176933/test-cases/41237716 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** iuiuttyy280112@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** iPhone 15 iOS 26.2 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Create scan expense in the workspace chat, uploading a valid receipt (**not pdf**) 2. Fully close the app (Drag up from the bottom and close it, or in emulator press Cmd+Shift+H,H and swipe the app up) 3. Reopen the app, open any expense with a receipt 4. Open the receipt, click the 3dot menu, click Download ## Expected Result: "Attachment successfully downloaded" is shown on the screen ## Actual Result: "Attachment error. Attachment can't be downloaded" appears on the screen. ## Workaround: Try to download again ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8945abe9-2b62-4aa5-8163-2f04ed85ab0a [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
